summary: The FinOps Specialist course is an 8-session program, spanning 40 academic hours, designed to prepare finance professionals for careers in cloud environments. The course covers a wide range of topics, including an introduction to AWS Cloud and its global infrastructure, basic AWS Cloud architectural principles, the AWS Cloud value proposition, and key AWS services and their use cases. Participants will learn about cloud pricing and billing, finance tools and options, AWS cost explorer, and cost control techniques such as tags, alerts, and budgeting. The course also includes an introduction to Kubernetes (K8S) from a FinOps perspective, third-party FinOps tools, cloud cost monitoring, and best practices for success. The program concludes with a final exam or exercise based on AWS Cost Explorer. The course is offered in a hybrid format, allowing participants to attend either on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or via Zoom.

COURSE NAME: FinOps Specialist

COURSE OVERVIEW: This course is designed to prepare finance professionals for careers in cloud environments. It focuses on the principles and practices of FinOps, cloud financial management, and AWS Cloud services. Participants will gain the skills needed to manage cloud costs effectively and understand the financial aspects of cloud computing.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 31.01.2025.
- Duration: 8 sessions over 40 academic hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held both on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participants' preferences.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and its basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Explain the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Identify key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Discuss basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe the basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.
- Cloud Concept and overall review.
- Main Cloud Services.
- FinOps – What is it and why is it needed?
- Cloud pricing and billing.
- Finance tools and options (commitments, agreements, etc.).
- AWS Cost Explorer introduction.
- Use case and brainstorming sessions.
- Cost Control – Tags, Alerts, Budgeting, etc.
- Kubernetes (K8S) – Introduction, high-level technical review, and FinOps perspective.
- FinOps third-party tools and products.
- Cloud cost monitoring.
- Tips for success and best practices.
- Final Exam/Exercise – based on AWS Cost Explorer.

CERTIFICATIONS: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner (Foundational).

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and register, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or via email at esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.
- Bar-Ilan University is committed to providing innovative and specialized programs to prepare professionals for the future.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is part of Bar-Ilan University's initiative to develop the next generation of finance professionals in the cloud domain.
